metadata.title: Wednesday, 4th March, 2015
metadata.session: FOURTH SESSION OF THE ELEVENTH ASSEMBLY

parts: (a)    when the Government will extend the vaccination of cattle against corridor disease to Central Province and other parts of the country;
(b)    what drug is used to vaccinate against corridor disease; and
(c)    when the drug will be available to individual farmers who are interested in vaccinating their animals themselves.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a)    when the construction of the road to Nansanga Farm Block in Serenje District will commence; and
(b)    what the estimated cost of the project is.
(a)    whether the position of Deputy Permanent Secretary in Government has been abolished;
(b)    if not, what the total establishment of Deputy Permanent Secretary is; and
(c)    how many positions were filled as of 30th September, 2014.
(a)    why Luena Barracks in Kaoma District is not connected to the new water system in the District; and
(b)    when the Barracks will be connected to the new water system.

questions.minister: Minister of Finance how much revenue, on average per month, is raised from taxes imposed on imported used vehicles.

parts: (a)    how many dip tanks are earmarked for construction in Kapiri Mposhi Parliamentary Constituency in 2015;
(b)    in which areas the dip tanks will be constructed; and
(c)    what the estimated cost of the project is.

questions.minister: Minister of Community Development, Mother and Child Health when qualified medical personnel will be deployed to the following health centres in Mitete District
parts: (a)    Kakulunda;
(b)    Mitete;
(c)    Sikunduko;
(d)    Mataba; and
(e)    Nyala.

questions.minister: Minister of Community Development, Mother and Child Health when a maternity wing will be constructed at  Chabilika Rural Health Centre in Nchelenge District.

parts: (a)    when the Zambia National Broadcasting Corporation (ZNBC) will be transformed into a fully fledged public broadcaster;
(b)    whether a Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) between ZNBC and the Swedish Radio exists; and
(c)    if so, what the benefits of the MOU to ZNBC are.

questions.minister: Minister of Community Development, Mother and Child Health
parts: (a)    why works on the Voluntary Counseling and Testing Block at Chinkhombe Rural Health Centre in Mkaika Parliamentary Constituency were abandoned;
(b)    what the name of the contractor for the project is;
(c)    what the cost of the project is; and
(d)    what the way forward on the project is.
